metadata.Title: CVE-2020-20898 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer Overflow vulnerability in function filter16_prewitt in libavfilter/vf_convolution.c in Ffmpeg 4.2.1, allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service or other unspecified impacts.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-20898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavformat58 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavutil56 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libswresample3 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libswscale5 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
